instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00840: What is 820-00840? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.820-00875: What is 820-00875? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.ALL_SYS_PWRGD: What is ALL_SYS_PWRGD? ALL_SYS_PWRGD is present when PP1V8_S3, PP5V_S3, PP1V2_S3, PP1V05_S0, PP5V_S0, PP3V3_S0, & PP1V5_S0 are present and working. If any of these rails is not working, ALL_SYS_PWRGD will be pulled down and the machine will not turn on. .
definitions.PP3V3_G3H: What is PP3V3_G3H? PP3V3_G3H is a 3.3v power line that is present when the machine is in a Global System Hardware Off state, and should come on before most other rails so that the USB-C circuitry can be powered for the charger.
definitions.ALL_SYS: What is ALL_SYS? This is a typo of ALL_SYS_PWRGD When you see ALL_SYS, assume they meant to type ALL_SYS_PWRGD.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Power, no Boot.
threads.message:
I've seen several <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> and <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00875</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> boards the past ~3 months that all had the exact same symptoms; they power on (trackpad clicks), ppbus is stable at 13v, but there's no other progress/booting. All boards are perfectly clean with no history of drop/liquid/etc. They all came in with similar descriptions, "stopped powering on". I have tried loading new BIOS's on a few of the boards, and it didn't help, so I put the original back on each. No shorts found across all coils, nothing getting hot except CPU (gets appropriately warm, etc). They all power on with trackpad click, fan spin, but no chime/boot/video, etc.

I'm working on an <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> board now, measurements below:

<SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3H</SIGNAL>: 3.4v
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>: 13.06v
<SIGNAL>ALL_SYS_PWRGD</SIGNAL>: 3.22v
<SIGNAL>PP2V9_SYSCLK</SIGNAL>: 3.0v
<SIGNAL>PP3V1_RTC</SIGNAL>: 3.09v
<SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S0_L</SIGNAL>: 3.3v
<SIGNAL>GTVR_FCCM</SIGNAL>: .022v
USB Mouse light flickers for literally .1 seconds then no activity.

<SIGNAL>ALL_SYS</SIGNAL> looks very slightly low, but everything else looks fine. CPU gets warm as normal, but no chime/boot/etc. Any ideas?

Thanks in advance!

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Power, no Boot.
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Power, no Boot.
threads.message: Sounds like a bad CPU to me...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Power, no Boot.
threads.message: Do you get voltage on all secondary supplies (big coils)?
